item.title: Selinux and Nginx
item.description: SELinux DigitalOcean’s Fedora droplets include SELinux. I don’t know a great deal about SELinux but it’s presumably a good thing for helping prevent privilege escalations and so on. Unfortunately, it can be troublesome when trying to do simple static site stuff with nginx. nginx With Fedora and nginx and selinux all in use simultaneously, you are allowed to tell nginx to serve files that are owned/grouped under a user other than nginx’s.
